data.title: crash in Tiberian Sun skirmish game(Exception of type `System.OverflowException`)
data.body:
I was testing a random map in Tiberian Sun while I got this crash. I'm using bleed, heavily edited for map generation but I haven't touched the code where this exception occurs, and based on the message it doesn't seem to be related. I can reproduce it in the replay. Happens just after I destroy the MCV of the dark brown GDI bot, while the Nod bots are also fighting.

[map file](http://thomasvanderberg.nl/misc/__random__.oramap)
[replay file](http://thomasvanderberg.nl/misc/OpenRA-2016-04-06T111519Z.orarep)


data.title: [AI] [TD] Enable Repair Pad build for AI --> needed for MCV replacement
data.body:
Currently, the AI in TD does not build repair pads (set to 0 in yaml). These are now [since playtest 20160403] required to build MCVs. Ergo the AI is not able to replace destroyed Construction Yards

Issue --> https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11057

data.title: Use vertex depths for rendering terrain depth preview.
data.body:
This implements the second and one of the most fiddly steps towards #7520.

Initial support for defining 3d positions is added, and `TerrainSpriteLayer` is set up to give each tile a z coordinate evaluated at the center of the tile.  The projection matrix is expanded to transform the raw z coordinates into normalized device coordinates... this was tricky to solve and is the most likely place to find bugs because any vertex mapped outside the range -1...1 it will be discarded, leaving a hole in the map.  Finally, the depth preview is adjusted to combine the vertex depth with the depth sprite to produce the final depth image that is drawn into the color buffer.  It will eventually be written into the depth buffer, but we don't need that yet so it's not included here.

The feature must be explicitly enabled by defining `EnableDepthBuffer` on the MapGrid so it shouldn't affect the classic mods (but this should be tested) or ts once the test commit is dropped.  Because actors etc don't write sensible vertex z coordinates they end up being discarded for most map scroll positions (reason explained above).  My [depthbuffer-part-two](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/depthbuffer-part-two) branch prototypes that support, which shows off the almost-proper depth sorting that this pr is working towards.

Things to look out for / be aware of when testing:
- If the projection is wrong then holes will appear in the map, probably at the top or bottom of the screen or where the terrain is very high.
- The depth image should look consistent with the map everywhere (no sudden jumps in shade that aren't explained by the map tiles).
- I've included the test map that I uses for tweaking and debugging the depth transformations.
- Loading the "Town of Karasjok" map into the editor is a good way of getting a feeling for this.  You can enable depth rendering in the editor by starting a skirmish, enabling depth rendering, returning to the shellmap, then starting the editor.

Good luck!

data.title: [AI] [TD] Enable Repair Pad build for AI --> needed for MCV replacement
data.body:
Currently, the AI in TD does not build repair pads (set to 0 in yaml). These are now [since playtest 20160403] required to build MCVs. Ergo the AI is not able to replace destroyed Construction Yards.

PR --> https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11059

data.title: TD Visceroids
data.body:
In TD playtest version 20160403 Visceroids don't attack anything when spawned from Chem Troopers. (Currently untested if it is spawned via map.)

Shown in replay example at 9:20 and onward.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/n46hvd1ag7a5hkx/OpenRA-2016-04-05T194601Z.orarep?dl=0

data.title: TD Stealth Tanks
data.body:
In TD playtest version 20160403 Tanks and other turreted vehicles can lock onto Stealth tanks. Even though they are in stealth mode once the turret is locked they can fire on them.

Shown in replay example at 12:04 to 12:16.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/n46hvd1ag7a5hkx/OpenRA-2016-04-05T194601Z.orarep?dl=0

data.title: Light Tank Vehicle Husk
data.body: Since nobody uses mechanics to reuse light tank husks, and the only use of a husk of a light tank is to block an ore refinery / war factory. Is there any chance that they could be removed from the game?

data.title: Fix value of infantry emitted on sell
data.body: Closes #11045.

data.title: Audio feedback when queuing production
data.body:
(Playtest 20160403)
Previous versions of the game played an immediate "building" or "training" sound when you queued multiple units or buildings for production. 

Example: Clicking on rifle infantry and immediatly on the rocket infantry (queuing it) would play "training" sound twice. This gave an audio confirmation of your action.

Now the "training" sound of the queued unit plays only when the unit actually starts producing (so much later).

While this could be intentional it seems less usefull to me.

data.title: Fix shocktroopers shooting through walls
data.body: > Coils shouldn't change, and IMO an argument could be made for letting ttnk fire over walls too. Shock troopers definitely shouldn't, though.

data.title: Regarding walls ...
data.body: done

data.title: "Team colors" affecting (superweapon) countdown timers
data.body:
(Playtest 20160403)
When "team colors" are enabled the coutdown timers of super weapons (like GPS satelite) gets colored in team colors as well. So you could see **multiple** GPS **countdown timers** all **in the same** red **color.**

I say this is not helping since you usually want to know specifically (in order to prevent it) who's building it. Disabling team colors during game is an option (but an additional step) and many (new) players may not know how to do it (shortcut).

It would be usefull if **both pieces of information** would be represented: 
- TEAM "membership" (color) and 
- PLAYER COLOR.

Example:
- Ally: GPS countdown 3:00
- Enemy: GPS countdown: 2:15
  (both in their colors)

Additionaly words **"Ally" and "Enemy" could be team colored** (to distinguish multiple teams).
... or "Enemy (Team 2)", "Enemy (Team 3)" ...

Best regards.

data.title: GPS mouse tootltip reveals structure
data.body: If the fog of war hides a building but as an allied i have GPS i can see on the tooltip what kind of Building it is.

data.title: Subs not attackable
data.body:
A Submarine can't be attacked anymore by a helicopter or a land unit. 
a Gunboat can attack it.

data.title: Selling buildings spawns too many infantry units
data.body: Looks to me as if all mods were affected.

data.title: Incomplete Terrain rendering with Intel Graphics Media Accelerator 3600 series
data.body:
![openra-2016-04-04t192014z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18270506/14260393/050be690-fab4-11e5-96a6-9df19d8705b2.png)

If you look to this screenshot you can see, that i haven't some tiles on map, but all their specials are axists (see mini-map), but i don't see them - just black plane. This... trouble depends on size of the map and version:
- in last last last release i haven't any problems with maps
- in last last release and in last release (20151224) i had bugs only on big maps (160x160 and bigger)
- in this release (playtest) i have bugs with mediums maps (64x64 and bigger)
  I just can't play this release, because only small maps working correctly. It's very sadly :( I think that problem in my computer - but what can i do? If you needs logs or something else i'll attach them.

data.title: Fatal Error when starting OpenRA
data.body:
When starting OpenRA, I get a white screen and then a popup saying that there is a fatal error. 

I am currently running playtest-20160403. Release-20151224 works fine.

**Here are the contents of my exception.log:**

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Manifest..ctor(String modId)
   at OpenRA.ModData..ctor(String mod, Boolean useLoadScreen)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Can't give attack orders via standard left-click on enemy in left-click orders control scheme
data.body: On playtest-20160403, left-clicking on an enemy will select the enemy rather than attack it using left-click orders in all included mods. This is despite the appropriate cursor (attack or C4) being displayed over the enemy. Force fire works. Right-clicking will deselect as usual. Right-click orders works as normal.

data.title: Can't deploy MCV, send vehicles to service depot or land aircraft in left-click order mode
data.body:
It seems the latest playtest has a bug where I can't use the deploy or similar action on a vehicle or building, it just selects the building instead. I was able to deploy the MCV using the keyboard shortcut instead, but this makes the game quite unplayable for the rest.

I am using classic left-click orders and have verified it working with right-click orders.

data.title: Add a utility command to output an actor's MiniYaml tree
data.body:
Possibly taking in a map path (to a .zip/.oramap/directory).

Usage: `orautil ts --actor-yaml World mods/ts/maps/arivruns/`

If you exclude the map path just the default ruleset will be used (files in the `Rules` section of the manifest).

GitHub won't let me reopen #10771.
